## Methodology

For the Chicago, Seattle, Philadelphia, and Atlanta metropolitan areas: 

* Calculation of __location quotients__ for age 25-34, with and without a bachelor's degree, using 2011-2015 ACS data

* Mapping and _distance profile_ visualization of location quotients

* Modeling of associations between Millennial socio-demographic characteristics and residental location using Census microdata

## Model results (selected)

* __Education__ strongly associated with living nearer to the urban core across all four metropolitan areas

* __Living with parents__, __marriage__ and __children in the home__ associated with residential location farther from the urban core in all four metros

* __White collar employment__ strongly associated with residential location nearer to the urban core in Seattle and Atlanta; weaker association in Chicago and Philadelphia
